content: montana is a simple and colorful cowl i made it after watching the yellowstone series and it was inspired by gorgeous indian motifs presented in the show the cowl is worked seamlessly in the round from the bottom to top **sizes** one size circumference 60cm / 24 height 32 5cm / 13 **yarn** to make the cowl you ll need about 270m/297y of heavy dk or worsted weight yarn divided into 4 colors as follows c1 130m/143y c2 80m/88y c3 40m/44y c4 - 20m/22y note the yardage is estimated sample cowl was made with gabo wool kroopa wool 100% wool 100m / 109y per 50g **needles & notions** 5mm / us #8 circular needles for magic-loop or dpns or size needed to get the proper gauge 4mm / us #6 circular needles for magic-loop or dpns or two sizes smaller than the gauge needles 4 5mm / us #7 circular needles for magic-loop or dpns or one size smaller than the gauge needles stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving ends **gauge** 21 sts and 32 rounds = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 - in 1x1 rib pattern worked with 4mm / us #6 needles after wet blocking 21 sts and 24 rounds = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 - in stranded colorwork with 5mm / us #8 needles after wet blocking 1 https //www instagram com/comfortzoneknits/
